intro: Hesperogreigia berteroi, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant has basal leaves that are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its native habitat. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hesperogreigia berteroi is well-suited to drought conditions and thrives in sandy or rocky soils.
